citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
IACUC approved Protocol 00110 describes the use of post-mortem animal tissues for the training of endoscopic
procedures. There is an inconsistency in the protocol pertaining to the rationale for using animals. One part of the protocol
states the importance of using live animals for this protocol, but another part of the protocol states the benefits of using
postmortem tissues for this protocol.
Per this Section, a proposal to conduct an activity involving animals, or to make a significant change in an ongoing activity
involving animals, must contain a rationale for involving animals. A proposal for animal use should contain consistent
information and details about the proposed use of the animals in order for the IACUC to review and determine that the
proposed activities are in accordance with the requirements in this subchapter of the Animal Welfare Act. The IACUC
needs to address this item. Correct by 3/1/25.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
